channel.title: Little question :)
channel.description: kk i have a vps 500mb ram 10gb hd... runing runefx source but it crashes every single 2-3 hours. now im tryna find a better vps would a 700mb ram be good enough to handle 30-40 players? and will it crash or not. if yes please tell me how much ram and hd is recommended for this kind a source!

item.title: Little question :)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:9, topic:389036”]Because it is still on a physical server, you just have a virtual connection to it.[/quote]That doesn’t make it physical. The mind being part of the brain doesn’t make the mind a physical entity.

But even if you argue that a VPS is physical, it still does not have a power lead.

Read full topic

item.title: Little question :)
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

It isn’t just about the VPS specs, many other factors have an affect on it such as server stability and code as well as connection. You can’t state how many players something will hold exactly because other factors exist which will affect that.

As you probably know servers like Deltscape are known for being unstable and full of bugs which isn’t going to help lagg and server stability. RAM isn’t that much of an issue in rsps I’m sure 500MB would be fine. But I would look into improving stability of the server and the way it operates or using another base. Many stable servers exist:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

They may be blank but they are known for being stable. Another method you could use to improve server stability is by editing some of the code yourself and being more effiecient when adding new updated and rewriting old ones, many tutorials exist on improving the stability of unstable servers you just need to use Google. A lot more things affect it, I’m just giving you a general overview of the situation - feel free to PM me if you want a more in depth answer.

P A N I C:

Please don’t tell me your using VPSland?

I have to admit I have had some bad experiences with VPSland, so i wouldn’t personally recommend them. If you’re looking for a good VPS company see the sticky.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

I would also look into using Linux, It may seem hard at first but it’s actually a very good OS Though questions like this are popping up to much I think.

Read full topic
